name: fetchngs-public-data-rnaseq
title: Download Sequencing Data from Public Repositories (SRA/ENA/GEO)
description: Download raw sequencing data and metadata from public databases including NCBI SRA, ENA, DDBJ, and GEO. Perfect for reproducing published studies, meta-analyses, and accessing reference datasets.
content:
üì• Download Sequencing Data from Public Repositories

Access Publicly Available Sequencing Data in Minutes

The nf-core/fetchngs pipeline automatically downloads sequencing data and metadata from major public databases, making it easy to reproduce published studies, perform meta-analyses, or access reference datasets for method validation.

üéØ What This App Does

This app downloads raw FastQ files from public sequencing databases using simple accession IDs. It handles all the complexity of data retrieval and generates analysis-ready samplesheets compatible with other nf-core pipelines.

‚ú® Key Features

  • üåç Multiple Databases: Supports SRA, ENA, DDBJ, and GEO accessions

  • üìä Metadata Retrieval: Automatically fetches sample information via ENA API

  • ‚úÖ Quality Assurance: Verifies downloads with MD5 checksums

  • üîÑ Pipeline Integration: Generates samplesheets for nf-core/rnaseq and other pipelines

  • ‚ö° Efficient Downloads: Uses reliable FTP protocol for data transfer

üìö Supported Accession Types

You can download data using any of these identifier types:

  • SRA: Sequence Read Archive IDs (e.g., SRR11605097)

  • ENA: European Nucleotide Archive IDs (e.g., ERR4007730)

  • DDBJ: DNA Data Bank of Japan IDs (e.g., DRR171822)

  • GEO: Gene Expression Omnibus IDs (e.g., GSM4432381, GSE214215)

The pipeline automatically detects the ID type and retrieves data from the appropriate source.

üìã Input File Format

Create a simple CSV file with one accession ID per line:

SRR11605097
SRR11605098
GSM4432381
ERR4007730

That's it! No need to specify columns or headers - just list the accession IDs you want to download.

üìù Example Use Cases

  • Reproduce Published Study: Download data from a paper's SRA accessions

  • Meta-Analysis: Combine datasets from multiple studies

  • Method Validation: Test your analysis on benchmark datasets

  • Reference Data: Access well-characterized samples for comparison

üìä Output Files

After downloading, you'll receive:

Downloaded Data

  • üìÅ FastQ Files: Raw sequencing reads (single-end or paired-end)

  • ‚úÖ MD5 Checksums: Verification files to ensure data integrity

Analysis-Ready Files

  • üìÑ samplesheet.csv: Ready to use with nf-core/rnaseq or other pipelines

  • üó∫Ô∏è id_mappings.csv: Maps accession IDs to sample names with metadata

  • ‚öôÔ∏è multiqc_config.yml: Configuration for downstream quality control

Metadata

  • üìä Sample Information: Experiment details, library prep, sequencing platform

  • üî¨ Study Details: Publication info, organism, tissue type

üß¨ Downstream Analysis Integration

The generated samplesheet can be directly used with these nf-core pipelines:

  • RNA-seq: Gene expression analysis (nf-core/rnaseq)

  • ATAC-seq: Chromatin accessibility (nf-core/atacseq)

  • ChIP-seq: Protein-DNA interactions (nf-core/chipseq)

  • Any NGS pipeline: Custom workflows accepting standard samplesheets

‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Options

Output Format

Choose which nf-core pipeline format to generate samplesheets for:

  • rnaseq - For RNA sequencing analysis (most common)

  • atacseq - For ATAC-seq chromatin accessibility

  • taxprofiler - For metagenomic taxonomic profiling

  • viralrecon - For viral genome reconstruction

  • none - Generic download without pipeline-specific formatting

üí° Tips for Success

  • Start Small: Test with 2-3 accessions first before large downloads

  • Check Metadata: Review the id_mappings.csv to verify sample information

  • Network Time: Download time depends on file sizes and network speed

  • Storage Space: Ensure sufficient space for downloaded FastQ files

üî¨ Perfect For Research In

Reproducibility Studies ‚Ä¢ Meta-Analyses ‚Ä¢ Method Development ‚Ä¢ Comparative Genomics ‚Ä¢ Data Reanalysis ‚Ä¢ Benchmark Testing

Built with Nextflow ‚Ä¢ Powered by nf-core/fetchngs v1.12.0 ‚Ä¢ Containerized execution ‚Ä¢ Continuous integration tested

jobConfig.label: System Size
jobConfig.name: system_size
jobConfig.description: Select compute resources. XSMALL is sufficient for data downloads.

options.label: XSMALL (4 CPUs, 15GB RAM) - Default for downloads
SMALL (8 CPUs, 30GB RAM) - For large cohorts

spec.label: Accession ID List
spec.name: input
spec.description: CSV file with one accession ID per line (SRA/ENA/DDBJ/GEO). Example: SRR11605097 (one per line, no header needed).

spec.label: Output Directory
spec.name: output
spec.description: Directory where downloaded FastQ files and samplesheets will be saved.

spec.label: Downstream Pipeline Format
spec.name: pipeline_format
spec.description: Format samplesheet for a specific nf-core pipeline (or 'none' for generic output).
